qas.question: When were the technical rules for the Japanses version of men's rhythmic gymnastics formed?
What are the types of apparatuses used?

answers.text: the double rings, the stick, the rope, and the clubs
Groups do not use any apparatus

qas.question: What apparatus types are only used in Japan?
Who hosted the first Gymnastics World Championship?

context: The technical rules for the Japanese version of men's rhythmic gymnastics came around <b5_0>the <a0_0>1970s<b5_0/><a0_0/>. For individuals, <a1_0>only four types<a1_0/> of apparatus are used: <a2_0><b8_0>the double rings, the stick, the rope, and the clubs<b8_0/><a2_0/>. <a3_0>Groups do not use any apparatus<a3_0/>. The Japanese version includes <b6_0>tumbling performed on a spring floor<b6_0/>. Points are awarded based a 10-point scale that measures the level of difficulty of the tumbling and apparatus handling. On <a4_0><b7_0>November 27–29, 2003<b7_0/><a4_0/>, <b9_0>Japan<b9_0/> hosted first edition of the Men's Rhythmic Gymnastics World Championship.
